title: Ticket #5104: ENABLE_IPV6=true should be the default in 8.5 series
description: Early in the 8.5 series (8.5.1?) we should set ENABLE_IPV6 to true by default.
remarks:
2016-Mar-15 15:26:23 by adesmet:
Code review of [47675] "DNS lookups respect PREFER_IPV4."

Passed.

Everything outside of ipv6_addrinfo.cpp is perfect.

I believe the changes to ipv6_addrinfo.cpp are correct. I have some general style/readability/maintainability concerns, but they should not block deployment of this.

  • I'd prefer direct structure assignment over memcpy. So *rv = *ai instead of memcpy(rv, ai, sizeof(addrinfo)). Direct assignment is clearer (and could theoretically be faster, although probably not).

  • Why does struct shared_context have a constructor and destructor, but the implementation is using malloc/free (as opposed to new/delete)?

  • addrinfo_iterator::addrinfo_iterator silently drops results that are neither IPv4 nor IPv6. We should at least warn that we did so.

  • The fairly complex deep-copy-and-resort logic for an addrinfo chain seems misplaced in addrinfo_iterator::addrinfo_iterator. Perhaps it should be in shared_context::shared_context, or perhaps a new, separate global function.

2016-May-31 09:41:13 by tlmiller:
  • Changed memcpy to direct assignment.
  • I don't know, but since I didn't write the code I don't want to futz with it.
  • Warning added.
  • Done. Constructor looks a little cleaner now.
